categories.name: Technology
documents: Machine learning algorithms enable computers to learn from data without explicit programming.
Neural networks are computational models inspired by the human brain's structure and function.
Deep learning uses multiple layers to progressively extract higher-level features from raw input.
Natural language processing helps computers understand and generate human language.
Computer vision allows machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world.
Reinforcement learning trains agents to make decisions by rewarding desired behaviors.
Cloud computing delivers computing services over the internet on a pay-as-you-go basis.
Blockchain technology creates immutable records of transactions across distributed networks.
Quantum computing leverages quantum mechanics to solve complex problems exponentially faster.
Edge computing processes data closer to the source to reduce latency and bandwidth usage.
Cybersecurity protects systems, networks, and data from digital attacks and unauthorized access.
DevOps practices combine software development and IT operations for faster delivery cycles.
Microservices architecture structures applications as collections of loosely coupled services.
Containerization packages software with all dependencies for consistent deployment across environments.
APIs enable different software applications to communicate and share data seamlessly.
Distributed systems coordinate multiple computers to work together as a unified system.
Data encryption transforms readable data into coded form to prevent unauthorized access.
Version control systems track changes to code and enable collaboration among developers.
Agile methodology emphasizes iterative development and continuous feedback from stakeholders.
Test-driven development writes tests before code to ensure software quality and reliability.
Continuous integration automatically builds and tests code changes to catch errors early.
Infrastructure as code manages and provisions computing resources through machine-readable files.
Serverless computing runs code without managing servers, charging only for actual usage.
GraphQL provides a flexible query language for APIs with precise data fetching capabilities.
WebAssembly enables high-performance applications to run in web browsers at near-native speed.
Internet of Things connects physical devices to the internet for data collection and control.
5G networks deliver faster speeds, lower latency, and support for massive device connectivity.
Artificial intelligence systems perform tasks that typically require human intelligence.
Big data analytics processes vast volumes of information to discover patterns and insights.
Data mining extracts valuable knowledge from large datasets using statistical methods.
Augmented reality overlays digital information onto the real world through smart devices.
Virtual reality creates immersive computer-generated environments for users to explore.
Biometric authentication uses unique physical characteristics to verify user identity.
Zero-trust security assumes no user or device is trustworthy by default within networks.
Software-defined networking separates network control from hardware for flexible management.
Robotic process automation uses software robots to automate repetitive digital tasks.
Digital twins create virtual replicas of physical objects for simulation and analysis.
Federated learning trains machine learning models across decentralized devices without sharing data.
Synthetic data generation creates artificial datasets that mimic real-world information.
Low-code platforms enable rapid application development with minimal hand-coding required.
Progressive web apps combine the best features of websites and mobile applications.
Chaos engineering deliberately introduces failures to test system resilience and reliability.
Site reliability engineering applies software engineering principles to infrastructure and operations.
Feature flags enable toggling functionality without deploying new code versions.
A/B testing compares two versions to determine which performs better with users.
Memory-safe programming languages prevent common security vulnerabilities like buffer overflows.
Functional programming emphasizes immutable data and pure functions without side effects.
Reactive programming handles asynchronous data streams and propagates changes automatically.
Compiler optimization transforms code to improve performance without changing functionality.
Code refactoring improves internal structure while preserving external behavior and functionality.
Database sharding distributes data across multiple servers to improve scalability and performance.
Load balancing distributes network traffic across multiple servers to ensure high availability.
Content delivery networks cache content geographically closer to users for faster access.
OAuth enables secure delegated access without sharing passwords between services.
Service mesh provides infrastructure layer for handling service-to-service communication.
Event-driven architecture processes events asynchronously to build responsive systems.
Message queues decouple system components by enabling asynchronous communication.
Websockets enable bidirectional real-time communication between clients and servers.
REST APIs use HTTP methods to perform operations on resources in distributed systems.
gRPC provides high-performance RPC framework using HTTP/2 and protocol buffers.
Database indexing improves query performance by creating efficient data access paths.
Caching strategies reduce latency by storing frequently accessed data in memory.
Rate limiting controls the number of requests to prevent system overload.
Circuit breakers prevent cascading failures in distributed systems.
API gateways manage and secure access to backend microservices.
Observability provides insights into system behavior through metrics, logs, and traces.
Distributed tracing tracks requests across multiple services in microservices architecture.
Log aggregation centralizes logs from multiple sources for analysis and troubleshooting.
Monitoring systems track application performance and system health in real-time.
Alerting mechanisms notify teams of system issues and anomalies automatically.
Backup strategies ensure data protection through regular copies and disaster recovery plans.
Redundancy eliminates single points of failure by duplicating critical components.
Failover mechanisms automatically switch to backup systems when primary systems fail.
Data replication copies data across multiple locations for availability and disaster recovery.
Consensus algorithms enable distributed systems to agree on shared state.
Distributed locks coordinate access to shared resources across multiple processes.
Time-series databases optimize storage and querying of time-stamped data.
Graph databases model and query relationships between interconnected data.
NoSQL databases provide flexible schemas for handling diverse data types.
In-memory databases store data in RAM for extremely fast read and write operations.
Database migrations manage schema changes across different environments.
ETL processes extract, transform, and load data between systems.
Data warehouses centralize data from multiple sources for analytics and reporting.
Data lakes store raw data in native format for future analysis.
Stream processing analyzes data in real-time as it flows through the system.
Batch processing handles large volumes of data in scheduled intervals.
MapReduce programming model processes large datasets across distributed clusters.
Apache Spark provides fast in-memory data processing for big data workloads.
Kubernetes orchestrates containerized applications across clusters of machines.
Docker containers package applications with dependencies for consistent deployment.
Helm charts package Kubernetes applications for easy deployment and management.
GitOps uses Git as single source of truth for declarative infrastructure.
Blue-green deployment reduces downtime by running two identical production environments.
Canary releases gradually roll out changes to subset of users before full deployment.
Rolling updates incrementally replace old versions with new ones without downtime.
Immutable infrastructure replaces servers rather than updating them in place.
Configuration management automates server provisioning and maintenance.
Secret management securely stores and controls access to sensitive credentials.
Network segmentation divides networks into isolated segments for security.
Intrusion detection systems monitor networks for malicious activity and policy violations.
Penetration testing simulates attacks to identify security vulnerabilities.
Vulnerability scanning automatically identifies security weaknesses in systems.

categories.name: Science
documents: Photosynthesis converts sunlight into chemical energy stored in glucose molecules.
DNA contains genetic instructions for the development and functioning of living organisms.
Evolution occurs through natural selection favoring traits that improve survival and reproduction.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
Gravity is the force that attracts objects with mass toward each other.
Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong nothing can escape.
The Big Bang theory explains the universe's origin from an extremely hot, dense state.
Quantum mechanics describes the behavior of matter and energy at atomic scales.
Chemical reactions involve the rearrangement of atoms to form new substances.
Ecosystems consist of living organisms interacting with their physical environment.
Cells are the basic structural and functional units of all living things.
Neurons transmit electrical signals to communicate information throughout the nervous system.
Antibodies are proteins produced by the immune system to neutralize harmful pathogens.
Mitochondria generate most of the cell's energy supply through cellular respiration.
Tectonic plates move across Earth's surface causing earthquakes and volcanic activity.
Climate change results from increasing greenhouse gases trapping heat in the atmosphere.
Biodiversity refers to the variety of life forms within ecosystems and across the planet.
The water cycle describes the continuous movement of water through evaporation and precipitation.
Entropy measures the disorder or randomness in a thermodynamic system.
Nuclear fusion combines atomic nuclei to release tremendous amounts of energy.
Stem cells can differentiate into various specialized cell types in the body.
CRISPR technology enables precise editing of genes within living organisms.
The periodic table organizes chemical elements by atomic number and similar properties.
Relativity theory revolutionized our understanding of space, time, and gravity.
Dark matter comprises most of the universe's mass but doesn't emit or absorb light.
Plate tectonics explains continental drift and the formation of mountains and oceans.
The carbon cycle describes how carbon moves between atmosphere, land, and ocean.
Electromagnetic radiation includes radio waves, visible light, and gamma rays.
Chromosomes carry genetic information in the form of genes within cell nuclei.
Antibiotic resistance occurs when bacteria evolve to survive exposure to antimicrobial drugs.
The greenhouse effect naturally warms Earth's surface by trapping heat in the atmosphere.
Protein folding determines the three-dimensional structure and function of molecules.
Exoplanets orbit stars outside our solar system and may harbor conditions for life.
The immune system defends the body against pathogens through innate and adaptive responses.
Epigenetics studies changes in gene expression without altering DNA sequences.
Ocean currents distribute heat around the planet influencing climate patterns globally.
Renewable energy sources include solar, wind, hydroelectric, and geothermal power.
The human genome contains approximately three billion base pairs of DNA.
Symbiosis describes close interactions between different species living together.
Radioactive decay transforms unstable atomic nuclei into more stable configurations.
The nitrogen cycle converts atmospheric nitrogen into forms usable by living organisms.
Metamorphosis is the biological process of transformation from larva to adult form.
Thermodynamics studies the relationships between heat, work, and energy in systems.
Oxidation involves the loss of electrons during chemical reactions.
The ozone layer protects life on Earth by absorbing harmful ultraviolet radiation.
Fossils provide evidence of ancient life forms and evolutionary history.
Genetic mutations introduce variations that drive evolutionary change over time.
The Doppler effect causes frequency shifts in waves from moving sources.
Superconductors conduct electricity without resistance at very low temperatures.
Nanotechnology manipulates matter at the atomic and molecular scale for various applications.
Enzymes catalyze biochemical reactions by lowering activation energy requirements.
Cellular division enables growth and reproduction through mitosis and meiosis.
RNA molecules play crucial roles in protein synthesis and gene regulation.
Homologous structures in different species suggest common evolutionary ancestry.
Natural selection acts on genetic variation within populations over generations.
Adaptive radiation occurs when species diversify rapidly to fill ecological niches.
Gene flow transfers genetic material between populations through migration.
Genetic drift causes random changes in allele frequencies in small populations.
Speciation creates new species through reproductive isolation and divergence.
Convergent evolution produces similar traits in unrelated species facing similar environments.
Coevolution describes reciprocal evolutionary changes between interacting species.
Molecular clocks estimate divergence times using mutation rates in DNA.
Phylogenetic trees illustrate evolutionary relationships among species.
Horizontal gene transfer moves genetic material between organisms without reproduction.
Endosymbiotic theory explains the origin of mitochondria and chloroplasts.
Vestigial structures are remnants of organs that served functions in ancestral species.
Biogeography studies the distribution of species across geographic areas.
Island biogeography examines how isolation affects species diversity and evolution.
Punctuated equilibrium suggests evolution occurs in rapid bursts separated by stasis.
Artificial selection breeds organisms for desired traits through human intervention.
Genetic engineering modifies organisms by directly manipulating their DNA.
Recombinant DNA technology combines genetic material from different sources.
PCR amplifies specific DNA sequences for analysis and manipulation.
Gel electrophoresis separates DNA fragments by size for identification.
DNA sequencing determines the precise order of nucleotides in genetic material.
Genomics studies entire genomes to understand genetic function and variation.
Proteomics analyzes the complete set of proteins in cells or organisms.
Metabolomics examines all metabolites in biological samples.
Bioinformatics uses computational tools to analyze biological data.
Systems biology studies complex interactions in biological systems.
Neuroscience investigates the structure and function of nervous systems.
Cognitive psychology explores mental processes like perception and memory.
Behavioral ecology examines how behavior affects survival and reproduction.
Population dynamics models changes in species abundance over time.
Community ecology studies interactions among species in ecosystems.
Succession describes predictable changes in ecosystem composition over time.
Trophic cascades show how predators affect entire food webs.
Keystone species have disproportionate effects on ecosystem structure.
Nutrient cycling moves essential elements through biotic and abiotic components.
Primary productivity measures energy captured by photosynthesis in ecosystems.
Biomagnification concentrates toxins at higher trophic levels.
Carrying capacity limits population size based on available resources.
Density-dependent factors regulate populations based on crowding.
r-selection favors rapid reproduction in unstable environments.
K-selection favors competitive ability in stable environments.
Metapopulations consist of spatially separated groups connected by dispersal.
Source-sink dynamics involve productive and unproductive habitat patches.
Conservation biology applies science to preserve biodiversity.
Habitat fragmentation divides continuous habitats into isolated patches.
Corridors connect habitat fragments allowing species movement.
Extinction vortex describes positive feedbacks accelerating species decline.
Minimum viable population size ensures long-term species survival.

categories.name: Literature
documents: To be, or not to be, that is the question from Shakespeare's Hamlet.
All that glitters is not gold, a warning against judging by appearances.
The pen is mightier than the sword emphasizes the power of written communication.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God.
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times from A Tale of Two Cities.
Call me Ishmael is the famous opening line of Moby-Dick by Herman Melville.
Pride and Prejudice explores themes of love, marriage, and social class in Regency England.
The Great Gatsby depicts the American Dream and its corruption in the Jazz Age.
One Hundred Years of Solitude weaves magical realism into the Buend√≠a family saga.
1984 by George Orwell warns of totalitarianism and government surveillance.
To Kill a Mockingbird addresses racial injustice through the eyes of a child.
The Odyssey recounts Odysseus's long journey home after the Trojan War.
Paradise Lost retells the biblical story of humanity's fall from grace.
Jane Eyre follows an orphan's journey to independence and self-discovery.
Hamlet's soliloquies explore existential questions about life, death, and purpose.
The Road presents a post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son.
Beloved examines the psychological scars of slavery in post-Civil War America.
Crime and Punishment delves into guilt, redemption, and moral philosophy.
The Canterbury Tales presents medieval life through pilgrims' diverse stories.
Invisible Man explores African American identity and social invisibility.
Don Quixote satirizes chivalric romances through a delusional knight's adventures.
The Divine Comedy journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
Wuthering Heights tells a dark tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.
The Catcher in the Rye captures teenage angst and alienation in post-war America.
Frankenstein questions the ethics of scientific ambition and creation of life.
The Brothers Karamazov explores faith, doubt, and morality through three siblings.
Mrs Dalloway captures a single day in the life of a London socialite.
The Sound and the Fury employs stream of consciousness to depict a family's decline.
Waiting for Godot presents absurdist theater through two men awaiting someone who never comes.
The Metamorphosis depicts a man's transformation into an insect and resulting alienation.
The Iliad chronicles the Trojan War and heroic glory in ancient Greece.
Beowulf tells of a Scandinavian hero battling monsters to protect his people.
The Epic of Gilgamesh explores mortality and friendship in ancient Mesopotamia.
The Aeneid follows Aeneas founding Rome after fleeing Troy.
Le Morte d'Arthur compiles legends of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.
The Inferno describes Dante's journey through the nine circles of Hell.
Faust explores a scholar's pact with the devil for knowledge and pleasure.
King Lear examines family betrayal and the nature of power and madness.
Macbeth portrays ambition's corrupting influence and descent into tyranny.
Othello investigates jealousy, manipulation, and tragic misunderstanding.
Romeo and Juliet depicts star-crossed lovers destroyed by family feuds.
A Midsummer Night's Dream weaves together love and magic in an enchanted forest.
The Tempest features magic, revenge, and reconciliation on an isolated island.
Paradise Regained shows Christ resisting temptation in the wilderness.
Pilgrim's Progress allegorizes Christian's spiritual journey to salvation.
Gulliver's Travels satirizes human nature through fantastic voyages.
Robinson Crusoe tells of survival and civilization on a deserted island.
Clarissa explores virtue and seduction in an epistolary novel.
Tom Jones follows a foundling's adventures and moral development.
Tristram Shandy experiments with narrative form and digressions.
Sense and Sensibility contrasts reason and emotion in romance.
Emma features a well-meaning but misguided matchmaker.
Mansfield Park examines morality and social position in country estates.
Persuasion explores second chances and constancy in love.
Northanger Abbey parodies Gothic novels through a naive heroine.
Vanity Fair critiques society through characters striving for status.
David Copperfield presents Dickens' semi-autobiographical bildungsroman.
Great Expectations traces Pip's growth and changing expectations.
Oliver Twist exposes poverty and crime in Victorian London.
Bleak House satirizes the legal system through Jarndyce v Jarndyce.
Hard Times criticizes utilitarian philosophy and industrialization.
Little Dorrit examines imprisonment both literal and metaphorical.
Our Mutual Friend explores wealth, identity, and social mobility.
The Pickwick Papers chronicles the comic adventures of Samuel Pickwick.
Middlemarch interweaves multiple plots in provincial English life.
The Mill on the Floss depicts sibling relationships and social constraints.
Silas Marner shows redemption through love and community.
Adam Bede explores morality, seduction, and their consequences.
Daniel Deronda examines Jewish identity and Victorian society.
Tess of the d'Urbervilles portrays a pure woman destroyed by society.
Jude the Obscure critiques marriage and educational barriers.
The Mayor of Casterbridge follows a man's rise and fall from power.
Far from the Madding Crowd depicts independent Bathsheba's romantic choices.
The Return of the Native sets tragedy on Egdon Heath.
Heart of Darkness explores imperialism and darkness within humanity.
Lord Jim examines honor, guilt, and redemption.
Nostromo depicts political corruption in a South American republic.
The Secret Agent portrays anarchists and espionage in London.
Under Western Eyes explores revolutionaries and double agents.
Typhoon tests a ship captain's character in a storm.
The Nigger of the Narcissus examines men at sea facing death.
Youth contrasts romantic idealism with harsh reality.
Victory presents isolation, evil, and tragic romance.
Chance explores feminism through Flora de Barral.
The Portrait of a Lady follows Isabel Archer's quest for independence.
The Wings of the Dove examines sacrifice and betrayal.
The Golden Bowl depicts complex relationships and adultery.
The Ambassadors sends Lambert Strether to rescue Chad Newsome.
Washington Square tells of Catherine Sloper's disappointed hopes.
Daisy Miller contrasts American innocence with European sophistication.
The Turn of the Screw presents ambiguous supernatural horror.
The Beast in the Jungle explores unlived life and regret.
What Maisie Knew shows divorce through a child's perspective.
The Bostonians examines feminism and social reform.
The Princess Casamassima involves anarchists and aristocrats.
Roderick Hudson traces an artist's decline in Rome.
The American depicts Christopher Newman in Parisian society.
The Europeans contrasts American and European manners.
Confidence explores romantic triangles and misunderstandings.

categories.name: History
documents: The Roman Empire dominated the Mediterranean world for over a thousand years.
The Renaissance sparked a cultural rebirth in art, science, and philosophy across Europe.
The Industrial Revolution transformed societies from agrarian to industrial economies.
World War I reshaped global politics and led to the collapse of several empires.
The French Revolution overthrew the monarchy and established republican principles.
The American Revolution established the United States as an independent nation.
The fall of the Berlin Wall symbolized the end of the Cold War in 1989.
Ancient Egypt built magnificent pyramids as tombs for their pharaohs.
The Silk Road connected East and West facilitating trade and cultural exchange.
The Mongol Empire became the largest contiguous land empire in history.
The printing press revolutionized information dissemination in the 15th century.
The Civil Rights Movement fought for racial equality and justice in America.
The Space Race between the USA and USSR drove unprecedented technological advancement.
The Black Death killed millions across Europe and Asia in the 14th century.
The Age of Exploration led to European colonization of the Americas.
The Enlightenment emphasized reason, science, and individual rights in the 18th century.
The Holocaust resulted in the systematic genocide of six million Jews during World War II.
The Great Depression caused worldwide economic collapse in the 1930s.
Ancient Greece developed democracy, philosophy, and Western cultural foundations.
The Reformation challenged Catholic Church authority and split Western Christianity.
The Ottoman Empire controlled vast territories across three continents for six centuries.
The Napoleonic Wars reshaped European political boundaries in the early 19th century.
The Meiji Restoration modernized Japan and ended feudal shogunate rule.
The Treaty of Versailles officially ended World War I but planted seeds for World War II.
The Manhattan Project developed the first atomic bombs during World War II.
The Viking Age saw Norse explorers raid and settle across Europe and beyond.
The Byzantine Empire preserved Roman and Greek knowledge for over a millennium.
The Spanish Armada's defeat in 1588 marked England's rise as a naval power.
The Crusades were religious wars between Christians and Muslims for control of holy lands.
The Chinese dynasties shaped Asian civilization for thousands of years through innovation and conquest.
The Neolithic Revolution marked humanity's transition from hunting to agriculture.
The Bronze Age introduced metal tools and weapons revolutionizing ancient societies.
The Iron Age brought stronger tools enabling military and agricultural advances.
Mesopotamian civilization emerged between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers.
The Code of Hammurabi established one of the earliest written legal codes.
The Phoenicians developed an alphabet that influenced modern writing systems.
The Persian Empire created an efficient administrative system across vast territories.
Alexander the Great spread Hellenistic culture across three continents.
The Punic Wars between Rome and Carthage determined Mediterranean supremacy.
Julius Caesar's assassination triggered the end of the Roman Republic.
Augustus established the Roman Empire and Pax Romana.
The fall of Rome in 476 CE marked the beginning of the Middle Ages.
Charlemagne united much of Western Europe and promoted learning.
The Magna Carta limited royal power and influenced constitutional governance.
The Hundred Years' War between England and France shaped both nations.
The Black Death fundamentally altered European society and economy.
The Italian Renaissance produced masterpieces in art, literature, and architecture.
The invention of movable type printing spread knowledge rapidly.
The Protestant Reformation split Christianity and transformed European politics.
The Counter-Reformation renewed Catholic Church through internal reforms.
The Spanish Inquisition prosecuted heresy and enforced religious conformity.
The conquistadors conquered American empires seeking gold and converts.
The Columbian Exchange transformed global ecosystems and cultures.
The Atlantic slave trade forcibly transported millions from Africa.
The Scientific Revolution challenged traditional worldviews with empirical methods.
The Thirty Years' War devastated Central Europe over religious conflicts.
The English Civil War resulted in temporary republican government.
The Glorious Revolution established constitutional monarchy in England.
The Seven Years' War was the first truly global conflict.
The American colonies declared independence citing natural rights.
The French estates met triggering revolutionary transformation.
Napoleon Bonaparte rose from artillery officer to emperor of France.
The Congress of Vienna redrew Europe after Napoleonic defeat.
Latin American independence movements freed colonies from Spanish rule.
The Monroe Doctrine warned Europe against American intervention.
The opium wars opened China to Western influence forcibly.
The Indian Rebellion challenged British colonial rule.
The Crimean War introduced modern warfare tactics and nursing.
Italy unified under Piedmont-Sardinia leadership in the Risorgimento.
Germany unified under Prussian leadership after defeating France.
The Scramble for Africa divided the continent among European powers.
The Boxer Rebellion resisted foreign influence in China.
The Russo-Japanese War showed Asian power defeating European nation.
The Young Turk Revolution attempted to modernize the Ottoman Empire.
The Mexican Revolution transformed social and political structures.
The Easter Rising launched Irish independence movement.
The Russian Revolution overthrew the Romanovs and established communism.
The League of Nations attempted to prevent future wars.
The Irish Civil War followed independence from Britain.
Fascism rose in Italy under Mussolini's leadership.
The Great Depression spread globally from American stock crash.
The Spanish Civil War became a proxy conflict for ideologies.
Nazi Germany pursued aggressive expansion and genocide.
World War II became the deadliest conflict in human history.
The United Nations formed to maintain international peace.
The partition of India created separate Hindu and Muslim nations.
The Marshall Plan rebuilt Western Europe after the war.
The Chinese Communist Revolution established the People's Republic.
The Korean War divided the peninsula along ideological lines.
The Hungarian Revolution was crushed by Soviet intervention.
The Suez Crisis marked the decline of European colonial powers.
The Cuban Revolution brought Castro to power.
The Bay of Pigs invasion failed to overthrow Castro.
The Cuban Missile Crisis brought the world to nuclear brink.
The Vietnam War divided American society deeply.
The Cultural Revolution transformed Chinese society violently.
The Six-Day War reshaped the Middle East dramatically.
The Prague Spring was crushed by Warsaw Pact forces.
The Moon landing achieved Kennedy's space challenge.

categories.name: Business
documents: Strategic planning aligns organizational goals with market opportunities and resources.
Customer satisfaction drives business growth through repeat purchases and positive referrals.
Innovation distinguishes market leaders from competitors by creating unique value propositions.
Supply chain management optimizes the flow of goods from suppliers to customers.
Brand equity represents the value derived from consumer perception and recognition.
Market segmentation divides customers into groups with similar needs and behaviors.
Competitive advantage enables companies to outperform rivals in their industry.
Cash flow management ensures sufficient liquidity to meet operational obligations.
Risk management identifies and mitigates potential threats to business objectives.
Organizational culture shapes employee behavior and company performance.
Digital transformation integrates technology into all business areas to improve operations.
Customer relationship management systems track interactions to improve service and sales.
Business intelligence analyzes data to inform strategic decision-making.
Key performance indicators measure progress toward organizational objectives.
Lean methodology eliminates waste to improve efficiency and value delivery.
Six Sigma reduces process variation to improve quality and consistency.
Mergers and acquisitions combine companies to achieve synergies and growth.
Venture capital provides funding for high-growth startups in exchange for equity.
Return on investment measures the profitability of business expenditures.
Corporate social responsibility balances profit with ethical and environmental concerns.
Blue ocean strategy creates uncontested market space making competition irrelevant.
Porter's five forces analyzes industry competitiveness and profitability.
SWOT analysis evaluates strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.
Value chain analysis examines activities creating customer value.
Core competencies differentiate companies in ways difficult to imitate.
Disruptive innovation creates new markets and value networks.
First-mover advantage benefits pioneers entering new markets.
Network effects increase value as more users join platforms.
Economies of scale reduce per-unit costs as production increases.
Vertical integration controls multiple supply chain stages.
Horizontal integration acquires competitors in the same industry.
Diversification reduces risk by entering different markets.
Market penetration increases sales of existing products in current markets.
Product development creates new offerings for existing markets.
Market development finds new markets for existing products.
Pricing strategies position products based on value perception.
Cost leadership competes by offering lowest prices.
Differentiation creates unique products commanding premium prices.
Focus strategy targets specific market segments.
Brand positioning establishes distinct identity in consumer minds.
Marketing mix combines product, price, place, and promotion.
Segmentation targeting positioning framework guides marketing strategy.
Customer lifetime value predicts total profit from relationships.
Churn rate measures customer retention and satisfaction.
Net promoter score gauges customer loyalty and satisfaction.
Conversion rates track effectiveness of sales funnels.
Customer acquisition cost measures marketing efficiency.
Marketing attribution assigns credit to touchpoints.
A/B testing optimizes marketing campaigns through experimentation.
Growth hacking focuses on rapid experimentation for growth.
Viral marketing leverages networks for exponential spread.
Influencer marketing reaches audiences through trusted voices.
Content marketing attracts customers through valuable information.
Inbound marketing draws customers through helpful content.
Outbound marketing pushes messages to potential customers.
Permission marketing requires opt-in from consumers.
Email marketing nurtures leads through targeted campaigns.
Social media marketing engages audiences on digital platforms.
Search engine optimization improves organic visibility online.
Pay-per-click advertising drives traffic through sponsored listings.
Affiliate marketing rewards partners for customer referrals.
Referral programs incentivize customers to recruit others.
Loyalty programs reward repeat customers for continued business.
Customer service excellence differentiates brands through experience.
User experience design optimizes customer interactions.
Conversion rate optimization improves website effectiveness.
Sales funnel stages guide prospects toward purchase.
Lead generation attracts potential customers.
Lead nurturing develops relationships with prospects.
Sales qualification identifies promising opportunities.
Solution selling addresses customer problems specifically.
Consultative selling focuses on customer needs discovery.
Value selling emphasizes return on investment.
Account-based marketing targets high-value accounts.
Sales enablement equips teams with tools and knowledge.
Channel management coordinates distribution partners.
Direct sales reaches customers without intermediaries.
Retail strategy optimizes physical store performance.
E-commerce platforms enable online transactions.
Omnichannel retailing integrates multiple sales channels.
Inventory management balances stock levels with demand.
Just-in-time production minimizes inventory costs.
Demand forecasting predicts future customer needs.
Quality management ensures products meet standards.
Total quality management involves entire organization.
Kaizen emphasizes continuous incremental improvements.
Process reengineering redesigns workflows fundamentally.
Benchmarking compares performance against best practices.
Balanced scorecard tracks financial and non-financial metrics.
OKRs align teams around measurable objectives.
Agile project management iterates rapidly with feedback.
Waterfall methodology follows sequential project phases.
Scrum framework organizes work in time-boxed sprints.
Kanban visualizes workflow to optimize throughput.
Change management guides organizational transformations.
Stakeholder management balances diverse interests.
Crisis management responds to unexpected disruptions.
Business continuity planning ensures operational resilience.
Disaster recovery restores systems after disruptions.

categories.name: Health
documents: Regular physical exercise improves cardiovascular health and reduces disease risk.
Balanced nutrition provides essential nutrients for optimal body function and wellness.
Adequate sleep is crucial for cognitive function, emotional regulation, and physical recovery.
Stress management techniques reduce cortisol levels and improve overall health outcomes.
Preventive care detects health issues early when they are most treatable.
Mental health is equally important as physical health for overall wellbeing.
Hydration maintains body temperature, lubricates joints, and transports nutrients.
Vaccination prevents infectious diseases by training the immune system to recognize pathogens.
Chronic diseases like diabetes require ongoing management and lifestyle modifications.
Cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of death worldwide.
Mindfulness meditation reduces anxiety and improves emotional resilience.
Strength training builds muscle mass, increases bone density, and boosts metabolism.
The Mediterranean diet emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and healthy fats.
Regular health screenings detect cancers and other conditions in early stages.
Antibiotic stewardship prevents resistance by ensuring appropriate medication use.
Obesity increases risk for numerous health conditions including heart disease and diabetes.
Smoking cessation dramatically reduces risk for cancer, heart disease, and lung conditions.
Gut microbiome diversity influences digestion, immunity, and mental health.
Ergonomic workspaces prevent repetitive strain injuries and musculoskeletal disorders.
Social connections and relationships significantly impact longevity and quality of life.
Aerobic exercise strengthens the heart and improves oxygen delivery throughout the body.
Flexibility training maintains joint range of motion and prevents injuries.
High-intensity interval training alternates intense bursts with recovery periods.
Progressive overload gradually increases training demands for continued adaptation.
Recovery periods allow muscles to repair and grow stronger.
Proper form prevents injuries and maximizes exercise effectiveness.
Warm-up routines prepare the body for physical activity.
Cool-down periods help the body transition back to resting state.
Cross-training varies activities to prevent overuse injuries.
Periodization cycles training intensity for optimal performance.
Macronutrients include carbohydrates, proteins, and fats providing energy and structure.
Micronutrients like vitamins and minerals support biochemical processes.
Fiber promotes digestive health and helps regulate blood sugar.
Antioxidants protect cells from oxidative damage.
Omega-3 fatty acids support brain and heart health.
Probiotics promote beneficial gut bacteria populations.
Meal timing affects metabolism and energy levels throughout the day.
Portion control helps maintain healthy caloric intake.
Food labels provide information about nutritional content.
Whole foods contain more nutrients than processed alternatives.
Plant-based diets emphasize vegetables, fruits, legumes, and grains.
Protein synthesis requires adequate amino acid intake.
Glycemic index measures how foods affect blood sugar levels.
Caloric deficit creates weight loss by burning more than consumed.
Metabolic rate determines how quickly the body burns calories.
Sleep cycles alternate between REM and non-REM stages.
Circadian rhythms regulate sleep-wake patterns naturally.
Sleep deprivation impairs cognitive function and immune response.
Sleep hygiene practices improve sleep quality and duration.
Melatonin regulates the sleep-wake cycle naturally.
Insomnia involves difficulty falling or staying asleep.
Sleep apnea causes breathing interruptions during sleep.
REM sleep supports memory consolidation and emotional processing.
Deep sleep facilitates physical restoration and growth.
Anxiety disorders involve excessive worry and fear responses.
Depression affects mood, energy, and interest in activities.
Cognitive behavioral therapy modifies unhelpful thought patterns.
Psychotherapy addresses mental health through talking with professionals.
Psychiatric medications can help manage mental health conditions.
Resilience helps people adapt to adversity and stress.
Emotional intelligence involves recognizing and managing emotions.
Self-care practices support mental and physical wellbeing.
Burnout results from chronic workplace stress.
Work-life balance separates professional and personal time.
Blood pressure measures force of blood against arterial walls.
Cholesterol levels indicate cardiovascular disease risk.
Blood sugar regulation prevents diabetes complications.
Body mass index estimates healthy weight ranges.
Resting heart rate indicates cardiovascular fitness.
VO2 max measures maximum oxygen consumption during exercise.
Bone density testing assesses osteoporosis risk.
Mammograms screen for breast cancer in women.
Colonoscopies detect colorectal cancer early.
Pap smears screen for cervical cancer.
Prostate exams screen for prostate cancer in men.
Skin checks identify potentially cancerous moles.
Eye exams detect vision problems and diseases.
Dental checkups prevent tooth decay and gum disease.
Hearing tests identify hearing loss early.
Infectious diseases spread through pathogens like bacteria and viruses.
Herd immunity protects populations through widespread vaccination.
Hand washing prevents transmission of many infectious diseases.
Quarantine separates sick individuals to prevent disease spread.
Epidemiology studies disease patterns in populations.
Public health initiatives promote community wellbeing.
Sanitation systems prevent waterborne diseases.
Vector control reduces disease-carrying organism populations.
Disease surveillance monitors and tracks outbreaks.
Contact tracing identifies exposed individuals during outbreaks.
Telemedicine provides remote healthcare consultations.
Electronic health records centralize patient information.
Precision medicine tailors treatments to individual genetics.
Pharmacogenomics predicts drug responses based on genetics.
Immunotherapy harnesses the immune system against cancer.
Gene therapy treats diseases by modifying genetic material.
Regenerative medicine repairs or replaces damaged tissues.
Artificial organs replace failing biological organs.
3D bioprinting creates living tissues for transplantation.
Robotic surgery enables minimally invasive procedures.
Diagnostic imaging visualizes internal body structures.
Laboratory tests analyze samples for disease markers.
Biopsy examines tissue samples for abnormalities.
Radiation therapy treats cancer with targeted energy.

categories.name: Arts
documents: Renaissance art emphasized realism, perspective, and human anatomy.
Impressionism captured light and movement through visible brushstrokes.
Cubism fragmented objects into geometric shapes from multiple viewpoints.
Surrealism explored the unconscious mind through dreamlike imagery.
Abstract expressionism emphasized spontaneous, automatic creation.
Pop art drew inspiration from popular culture and mass media.
Minimalism reduced art to essential forms and colors.
Baroque art featured dramatic lighting and emotional intensity.
Rococo style emphasized ornate decoration and pastel colors.
Neoclassicism revived classical Greek and Roman aesthetics.
Romanticism emphasized emotion and individualism over reason.
Realism depicted everyday life without idealization.
Post-impressionism extended impressionism with symbolic content.
Fauvism used bold colors separated from realistic depiction.
Expressionism distorted reality to evoke emotional responses.
Dadaism rejected logic and embraced chaos and irrationality.
Futurism celebrated technology, speed, and modernity.
Constructivism used art for social and political purposes.
De Stijl reduced forms to horizontal and vertical lines.
Bauhaus integrated fine arts with crafts and technology.
Art nouveau featured flowing organic forms and decorative elements.
Art deco combined modernist styles with fine craftsmanship.
Sculpture shapes three-dimensional forms from various materials.
Photography captures images using light-sensitive surfaces.
Film combines moving images with sound to tell stories.
Animation brings drawings and models to life through motion.
Digital art creates imagery using computer technology.
Installation art transforms spaces into immersive experiences.
Performance art uses the artist's body and actions.
Video art incorporates moving images as artistic medium.
Street art brings artistic expression to public spaces.
Graffiti uses spray paint for visual messages and designs.
Murals cover large wall surfaces with painted imagery.
Printmaking reproduces images through various techniques.
Etching incises designs into metal plates for printing.
Lithography prints from stone or metal surfaces.
Woodcut carves images into wooden blocks for printing.
Silk screening pushes ink through mesh stencils.
Pottery shapes clay into functional and decorative vessels.
Ceramics encompasses all objects made from clay.
Glassblowing shapes molten glass through inflation.
Metalworking forges and shapes metal into objects.
Jewelry design creates wearable artistic pieces.
Textile art creates artistic works from fabric and fiber.
Weaving interlaces threads to create fabric.
Quilting stitches layers of fabric into patterns.
Embroidery decorates fabric with needle and thread.
Tapestry weaves pictorial designs into fabric.
Collage combines various materials into compositions.
Mixed media incorporates multiple artistic materials.
Assemblage constructs three-dimensional compositions from found objects.
Kinetic sculpture incorporates movement into artwork.
Land art uses natural landscapes as artistic medium.
Conceptual art prioritizes ideas over visual forms.
Photorealism creates paintings resembling photographs.
Hyperrealism enhances photographic accuracy beyond reality.
Color theory explores relationships between colors.
Composition arranges visual elements within artwork.
Perspective creates illusion of depth on flat surfaces.
Chiaroscuro uses strong contrasts between light and dark.
Sfumato creates soft transitions between colors and tones.
Impasto applies paint thickly for texture.
Glazing applies transparent layers of paint.
Underpainting establishes composition before final layers.
Gesso primes surfaces for painting.
Canvas provides fabric surface for painting.
Watercolor uses water-soluble pigments.
Acrylic paint dries quickly and resists water.
Oil paint allows extended working time.
Fresco paints directly onto wet plaster.
Tempera binds pigment with egg yolk.
Gouache creates opaque watercolor effects.
Pastel uses dry pigment sticks.
Charcoal creates expressive black drawings.
Graphite pencils vary in hardness for drawing.
Ink creates permanent line drawings.
Calligraphy produces decorative handwriting.
Typography designs letterforms and text layout.
Graphic design communicates visually through composition.
Logo design creates visual brand identities.
Poster design combines text and images for promotion.
Book design organizes text and images in publications.
Layout determines arrangement of visual elements.
Grid systems organize design elements systematically.
White space provides visual breathing room.
Hierarchy guides viewer attention through importance.
Contrast creates visual interest through differences.
Balance distributes visual weight within compositions.
Symmetry mirrors elements across axes.
Asymmetry creates dynamic compositions through imbalance.
Rhythm creates visual movement through repetition.
Proportion relates sizes of elements harmoniously.
Scale determines relative size of elements.
Unity creates coherence among design elements.
Variety adds visual interest through diversity.
Emphasis directs attention to focal points.
Movement guides the eye through compositions.
Pattern repeats elements to create visual texture.

categories.name: Music
documents: Classical music spans from medieval to contemporary periods.
Baroque music features ornate melodies and harmonic complexity.
Classical period emphasized clarity, balance, and formal structure.
Romantic music expressed emotion and individualism expansively.
Impressionist music created atmospheric and colorful soundscapes.
Modern classical music explored new harmonic and rhythmic possibilities.
Jazz originated from African American communities in New Orleans.
Blues expressed emotions through distinctive chord progressions.
Ragtime featured syncopated rhythms popular in early 1900s.
Swing jazz emphasized strong rhythmic drive for dancing.
Bebop developed complex improvisation at faster tempos.
Cool jazz featured relaxed tempos and lighter tones.
Hard bop incorporated blues and gospel influences.
Modal jazz improvised over scales rather than chord changes.
Free jazz abandoned traditional structures for spontaneous expression.
Fusion blended jazz with rock, funk, and other styles.
Rock and roll emerged from rhythm and blues in 1950s.
Rock music evolved into diverse subgenres and styles.
Heavy metal features distorted guitars and powerful vocals.
Punk rock emphasized raw energy and anti-establishment attitudes.
New wave incorporated electronic instruments and art influences.
Alternative rock diverged from mainstream rock conventions.
Grunge combined punk and metal influences from Seattle.
Indie rock emphasizes independent production and distribution.
Progressive rock created complex compositions and conceptual albums.
Pop music prioritizes catchy melodies and commercial appeal.
R&B combines rhythm and blues with soul influences.
Soul music emphasizes emotional vocal delivery and gospel roots.
Funk features strong rhythmic grooves and syncopation.
Disco dominated dance music in the 1970s.
House music pioneered electronic dance music in Chicago.
Techno developed electronic music in Detroit.
Trance creates hypnotic electronic soundscapes.
Drum and bass features fast breakbeats and heavy bass.
Dubstep emphasizes wobble bass and syncopated rhythms.
Hip hop originated in Bronx with DJing and MCing.
Rap delivers rhythmic vocal delivery over beats.
Trap music features rolling hi-hats and heavy bass.
Country music reflects rural American experiences and values.
Bluegrass features acoustic string instruments and harmonies.
Folk music preserves traditional songs and storytelling.
Gospel music expresses Christian faith through song.
Reggae originated in Jamaica with offbeat rhythms.
Ska combines Caribbean and American jazz influences.
Latin music encompasses diverse styles from Latin America.
Salsa blends Cuban and Puerto Rican musical traditions.
Bossa nova combines samba with jazz harmonies.
Flamenco features passionate Spanish guitar and vocals.
World music encompasses diverse global traditions.
Melody creates tuneful sequences of pitches.
Harmony combines simultaneous notes into chords.
Rhythm organizes music through time and beats.
Tempo determines the speed of musical performance.
Dynamics control volume and intensity variations.
Timbre distinguishes different instruments and voices.
Texture describes layers of sound in music.
Form structures musical compositions into sections.
Motif represents a short recurring musical idea.
Theme provides main melodic material for development.
Variation modifies themes while maintaining recognition.
Development transforms and elaborates musical material.
Recapitulation returns to earlier material.
Coda concludes musical pieces.
Introduction opens musical compositions.
Bridge transitions between sections.
Chorus provides repeated refrains in songs.
Verse presents changing lyrics over similar music.
Instrumentation selects instruments for performances.
Orchestration assigns parts to orchestra members.
Arrangement adapts music for specific ensembles.
Composition creates original musical works.
Improvisation creates music spontaneously.
Ensemble coordinates multiple performers.
Solo features individual performers.
Duet involves two performers.
Trio performs with three musicians.
Quartet comprises four performers.
Quintet includes five musicians.
Symphony orchestra includes full instrumental sections.
Chamber music performs with small ensembles.
Choir sings choral music together.
A cappella performs vocals without instrumental accompaniment.
Opera combines singing with theatrical drama.
Musical theater integrates songs into theatrical storytelling.
Aria features solo operatic singing.
Recitative delivers text in singing speech.
Sonata structures instrumental compositions.
Concerto features soloist with orchestra.
Suite contains multiple dance movements.
Overture introduces operas or larger works.
Etude develops specific technical skills.
Prelude introduces larger works or stands alone.
Fugue weaves multiple independent melodic lines.
Canon repeats melodies in overlapping voices.
Rondo alternates main theme with contrasting sections.
Scherzo provides light playful movements.
Minuet features moderate triple meter dance.
Waltz dances in triple meter.
March maintains steady rhythmic character.

categories.name: Philosophy
documents: Epistemology studies the nature and scope of knowledge.
Metaphysics examines the fundamental nature of reality.
Ethics investigates moral principles and values.
Logic analyzes correct reasoning and argumentation.
Aesthetics explores beauty and artistic judgment.
Political philosophy examines justice and governance.
Philosophy of mind investigates consciousness and mental states.
Philosophy of language studies meaning and communication.
Philosophy of science analyzes scientific methods and knowledge.
Existentialism emphasizes individual existence and freedom.
Phenomenology describes conscious experience from first-person perspective.
Rationalism claims reason as primary source of knowledge.
Empiricism asserts experience as basis for knowledge.
Idealism holds that reality is fundamentally mental.
Materialism maintains that only physical matter exists.
Dualism separates mind and body as distinct substances.
Monism views reality as unified single substance.
Pragmatism evaluates truth by practical consequences.
Utilitarianism maximizes overall happiness and well-being.
Deontology bases ethics on duties and rules.
Virtue ethics emphasizes character and moral excellence.
Consequentialism judges actions by their outcomes.
Relativism holds that truth varies with perspective.
Absolutism maintains objective universal truths exist.
Skepticism questions the possibility of certain knowledge.
Determinism claims all events are causally predetermined.
Free will argues humans can make genuine choices.
Compatibilism reconciles free will with determinism.
Nihilism denies objective meaning and values.
Absurdism confronts meaninglessness in existence.
Stoicism teaches virtue through reason and self-control.
Epicureanism pursues happiness through moderate pleasure.
Hedonism makes pleasure the highest good.
Asceticism practices self-denial and austerity.
Cynicism rejects social conventions and material desires.
Platonism posits perfect forms as ultimate reality.
Aristotelianism emphasizes empirical observation and logic.
Scholasticism integrates faith with rational inquiry.
Humanism centers on human values and dignity.
Enlightenment championed reason and individual rights.
Romanticism valued emotion and individualism.
Transcendentalism saw divinity in nature and humanity.
Marxism analyzes society through class conflict.
Feminism advocates gender equality and women's rights.
Postmodernism questions grand narratives and objective truth.
Structuralism studies underlying structures in culture.
Poststructuralism challenges stable meanings and structures.
Critical theory examines power and domination.
Hermeneutics interprets texts and human understanding.
Analytic philosophy emphasizes logical analysis.
Continental philosophy explores human existence and culture.
Social contract theory bases political legitimacy on agreement.
Liberalism protects individual rights and freedoms.
Conservatism values tradition and gradual change.
Socialism advocates collective ownership and equality.
Libertarianism maximizes individual liberty.
Anarchism opposes hierarchical authority.
Communitarianism emphasizes community over individualism.
Cosmopolitanism promotes universal human community.
Nationalism prioritizes national identity and sovereignty.
Multiculturalism values diverse cultural perspectives.
Functionalism explains mental states by their functions.
Behaviorism studies observable behavior only.
Identity theory equates mental states with brain states.
Eliminative materialism denies existence of mental states.
Property dualism distinguishes mental and physical properties.
Panpsychism attributes consciousness to all matter.
Emergentism sees consciousness arising from complexity.
Intentionality describes mental states as about things.
Qualia refers to subjective conscious experiences.
Hard problem questions why we have conscious experiences.
Philosophical zombie lacks consciousness despite normal behavior.
Chinese room argument challenges computational theory of mind.
Turing test assesses machine intelligence.
Artificial intelligence raises questions about machine consciousness.
Personal identity examines what makes someone the same person.
Ship of Theseus questions identity through change.
Bundle theory denies persistent self.
Ego theory posits continuous self.
Memory theory bases identity on psychological continuity.
Causal theory of reference connects words to objects.
Descriptivist theory defines meaning through descriptions.
Speech act theory analyzes language as action.
Pragmatics studies language use in context.
Semantics examines meaning in language.
Syntax analyzes grammatical structure.
Private language argument claims language requires public criteria.
Linguistic relativity suggests language shapes thought.
Induction infers general principles from specific cases.
Deduction derives conclusions from premises necessarily.
Abduction infers best explanation for observations.
Fallacy identifies errors in reasoning.
Validity ensures conclusions follow from premises.
Soundness requires valid arguments with true premises.
Consistency avoids contradictions in beliefs.
Coherence relates beliefs in mutually supporting system.
Foundationalism bases knowledge on certain foundations.
Coherentism justifies beliefs through mutual support.
Reliabilism validates beliefs through reliable processes.
Internalism requires accessible justification.
Externalism allows external justification factors.

categories.name: Psychology
documents: Cognitive psychology studies mental processes like thinking and memory.
Behavioral psychology examines observable behavior and conditioning.
Developmental psychology explores psychological growth across lifespan.
Social psychology investigates how people influence each other.
Clinical psychology diagnoses and treats mental health disorders.
Neuropsychology examines brain-behavior relationships.
Industrial psychology applies psychology to workplace settings.
Educational psychology studies learning and teaching processes.
Forensic psychology applies psychology to legal matters.
Health psychology examines psychological factors in physical health.
Classical conditioning associates neutral stimuli with responses.
Operant conditioning modifies behavior through consequences.
Reinforcement increases behavior frequency.
Punishment decreases behavior occurrence.
Extinction eliminates learned responses.
Generalization extends learned responses to similar stimuli.
Discrimination distinguishes between different stimuli.
Observational learning occurs through watching others.
Modeling demonstrates behaviors for others to imitate.
Vicarious reinforcement learns from observing consequences to others.
Working memory temporarily stores and manipulates information.
Long-term memory stores information indefinitely.
Episodic memory recalls personal experiences.
Semantic memory stores general knowledge and facts.
Procedural memory retains skills and habits.
Encoding transfers information into memory.
Storage maintains information in memory.
Retrieval accesses stored information.
Rehearsal repeats information to maintain it.
Chunking groups information into meaningful units.
Mnemonic devices aid memory through associations.
Recall retrieves information without cues.
Recognition identifies previously encountered information.
Primacy effect remembers first items better.
Recency effect recalls last items more easily.
Serial position effect combines primacy and recency.
Forgetting loses access to stored information.
Interference disrupts memory through competing information.
Decay weakens memories over time.
Repression blocks traumatic memories from awareness.
Schemas organize knowledge about concepts.
Heuristics provide mental shortcuts for decisions.
Availability heuristic judges likelihood by ease of recall.
Representativeness heuristic categorizes by similarity.
Anchoring bias overrelies on initial information.
Confirmation bias seeks information supporting beliefs.
Hindsight bias sees past events as predictable.
Fundamental attribution error attributes behavior to personality.
Self-serving bias credits successes to self, failures to situations.
Cognitive dissonance creates discomfort from conflicting beliefs.
Attitude formation develops evaluations of objects and people.
Persuasion changes attitudes through communication.
Conformity adjusts behavior to match group norms.
Obedience follows authority figure directions.
Compliance agrees to requests from others.
Group polarization strengthens group opinions.
Groupthink prioritizes consensus over critical thinking.
Social facilitation improves performance with audience.
Social loafing reduces effort in groups.
Deindividuation loses self-awareness in groups.
Bystander effect reduces helping with more witnesses.
Diffusion of responsibility shares accountability in groups.
Altruism helps others without expecting reward.
Aggression intends to harm others.
Prejudice holds negative attitudes toward groups.
Discrimination treats groups unfairly.
Stereotypes generalize characteristics to groups.
In-group bias favors own group members.
Out-group homogeneity sees out-group as similar.
Attachment bonds caregivers with infants.
Secure attachment trusts caregiver availability.
Anxious attachment fears caregiver abandonment.
Avoidant attachment maintains emotional distance.
Temperament describes innate personality traits.
Erikson's stages outline psychosocial development.
Piaget's stages describe cognitive development.
Kohlberg's stages trace moral reasoning development.
Object permanence recognizes hidden objects exist.
Conservation understands quantity remains despite appearance.
Egocentrism sees world only from own perspective.
Theory of mind attributes mental states to others.
Crystallized intelligence uses accumulated knowledge.
Fluid intelligence solves novel problems.
Multiple intelligences proposes diverse cognitive abilities.
Emotional intelligence perceives and manages emotions.
IQ tests measure cognitive abilities.
Personality traits describe consistent behavior patterns.
Big Five traits include openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism.
Psychoanalytic theory emphasizes unconscious motivations.
Id seeks immediate pleasure gratification.
Ego balances id and reality.
Superego represents moral conscience.
Defense mechanisms protect ego from anxiety.
Repression blocks threatening thoughts from awareness.
Projection attributes own feelings to others.
Rationalization justifies behavior with logical reasons.
Displacement redirects emotions to safer targets.
Sublimation channels unacceptable impulses productively.
Humanistic psychology emphasizes personal growth and self-actualization.
Self-concept represents beliefs about oneself.
